data.meta_site_name: Apostle Franklin Buckner Jr. Obituary | September 13, 2022 | Hampton, SC
data.text:
Pop,” as he was affectionately called, took on the spiritual form of immortality on Tuesday morning, September 13, 2022, at 4:43 AM, when the Lord called him home. He was born October 17, 1962, to the late Mr. Franklin Buckner and the late Ethel M. Buckner in Crocketville, South Carolina. He married the love of his life, Sharon Uletha Ulmer of thirty-five years, and to this union two daughters were born, Yelena Ceonte’ Buckner and Shalya Quentera Buckner. Apostle Buckner was the shepherd of the flock of the House of Transition and Transformation in Augusta, Georgia. He leaves to cherish his love and memories: his loving and devoted wife, Prophetess Sharon Buckner; children, Yelena Ceonte’ Buckner, Shayla Quentera Buckner, Ceon Ulmer, Shamika (Antrone) Williams, Frantika Simmons, Crystalyn Haynes, and Ashley Loundy; sisters, Judy Hicks, Brunson, Evangelist Arlene (Deacon Alfonso) Dunbar, (Varnille) Prophetess Debbie (Larry) Riley of Hampton, South Carolina, Latrell Hicks of Varnville, and Sylvester Buckner of Carrolton, Georgia; brother-in-law, Steven Jones (Ulmer); sisters-in-law, Lisa U. Kearse of Ulmer, South Carolina, and April of Aiken, South Carolina; aunts and uncles, Judy (David) Simmons, Earnest (Larcena) Moore, Isaiah (Lorine) Moore, David Buckner, Joseph Buckner, Dorothy Murdaugh, Annie Early Dailey of Varnville, South Carolina, Leroy Buckner of Aiken, South Carolina, Andrew (Samantha) Early, RTSCUSN, of Charleston, South Carolina, and Joe Early, Jr., of Newark, New Jersey; sixteen grandchildren; one great-grand; and a host of nieces, nephews, cousins, and loving friends.

To send flowers to the family or plant a tree in memory of Apostle Franklin Buckner Jr., please visit our floral store.
